page.title: 01The Area Around Robin Hood
page.content: The area is rural and mainly covered with managed grassland for the rearing of cows. There are numberous farms dotted around. Most of the land is owned by oe main landowner plus one or two other landowners. The fields are rented to individuals. Within these grass fields there are woods and specially grown copses for rearing and breeding of pheasants. There are arranged 'shoots' costing many hundreds of pounds per day during shooting season. Also a local hunt called The Holcombe Hunt uses the fields during the season. They catch mainly hares and a few foxes. There are 6 roads in area with ribbon development along most of them. There are two smallholdings producing various marketcrops on a commercial basis. Although it is quite a rural
